sense.def:
To count
pomeni našteti vsa števila po vrsti do določene vrednosti.

seg.quote: I'm going to count up to three.
After counting sixty the rest set off in pursuit.

sense.def:
To count all the things in a group
pomeni sešteti vse stvari v skupini, da bi videli, koliko jih je.

seg.quote: He withdrew to his office to count the money.

sense.def:
A count
je število, ki ga dobimo, če preštejemo določeno vrsto stvari.

seg.quote: The official government count has now risen to eight million.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
counts
, je v določenih okoliščinah najpomembnejša stvar.

seg.quote: What counts is how you feel about yourself.

sense.def:
Če določena stvar
counts for something
, je dragocena ali pomembna.

seg.quote: I felt that all my years there counted for nothing.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
counts as a particular thing
, tisto obravnavamo kot nekaj podobnega.

seg.quote: These benefits do not count as income for tax purposes.
They can hardly be counted as friends.

sense.def:
A count
je tudi evropski plemič enake veljave kot britanski
earl
.

To keep count of a number of things
pomeni zabeležiti, koliko stvari se je zgodilo.
To lose count of a number of things
pomeni, da se ne spominjamo, koliko stvari se je zgodilo.

Če je nekaj narobe
on a number of counts
, je narobe zaradi toliko vzrokov.

seg.quote: The use of these tests is criticized on two counts.
They are right on the first count but wrong on the second.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
counts against someone
, lahko povzroči, da je nekdo kaznovan ali zavrnjen.

To count on someone or something
ali
to count upon someone or something
pomeni zanesti se na nekoga ali nekaj.

seg.quote: Doctors could now count on a regular salary.

sense.def:
To count out a sum of money
pomeni šteti denar, medtem ko polagamo bankovce ali kovance na kupček.

To count up all things in a group
pomeni prešteti vse stvari v skupini.

seg.quote: I counted up my years of teaching experience.
